reviews.title: Conference Stay
reviews.text: This property exceeded my expectations in terms of service and location. Its layout makes it one of the better conference hotels that I have stayed. On property facilities are complimented by offsite dining options within a short walking distance.

Very good hotel, in a good location. Friendly staff, quick solution of problems (like when iron and tv could not be on together, or we needed more toiletries). Need to have complimentary breakfast, speacially if it is a business trip, hurry kind of visit.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Good location, awesome pool, enough space in the room for all of us - maybe just a little tight! Great bar food and the terrrace had cool views of the city. The hotel felt safe and easy to get around. Very close to National airport - a cool Uber ride from the terminal!
reviews.title: DC summer '13

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel and we had a lovely time here. The bed was comfortable and the bathrooms were clean and elegant. The view was incredible and we were in awe staring out the window. We were able to walk to shopping and look at all the shops and scene in Dupont Circle. This made our experience in DC wonderful and memorable. We would definitely return again.
reviews.title: Great memories!

reviews.text: Great service, a little pricey though. You defintely get what you pay for. Staff was excellent. Food was great. Lobby was clean and fresh. Hotel was easy to get around. Service at the restaurant was really good. Buffet was excellent. Cant wait to go back. Got anything we requested.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton was nice and clean. I am a germo phobe so I was so happy about that. Worth every penny. We were only there for two nights then had to move to a dumpy hotel for business reasons. We didnt get a chance to swim or go to the hotel restaurant because we were gone day and night. You are really close to all the shops and eateries of Dupont Circle. We had a good view from our room. Not as close to all the monuments so you have to walk a little ways, then take the metro. Good night life spots in the area. Some breweries too. We will stay there again!
reviews.title: We really liked it!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Washington Hilton for 4 nights on a sightseeing trip to DC. I have stayed at a lot of hotels in my life and this was by far the most enjoyable stay I've ever had. From the moment we got there, the staff was courteous and more than helpful. At check-in, the staff member checking me in was friendly, and accomodating. We were originally given a room on the 4th floor but my children wanted to be on an upper floor. He switched us to the 7th floor with no problem and had our rollaway bed moved to the new room. Our room was clean, large and very very comfortable. Even the rollaway bed was comfortable! The room was also extremely quiet. Best towels too, they were sooo comfortable!!! The maid kept our room very clean everyday regardless of how much of a mess my kids left. Internet service was pricey in the rooms ($25 a night) but it was free in the large lobby. We, and many other people, chose the lobby for Internet use. The pool was large and clean and the fitness area was better than my gym near my home. There is a large beautiful Terrace with several fireplaces and lots of comfortable seating to relax in with waiters available to bring food and drinks if you choose. The garage is accesible from hotel elevators and is well lit and safe. The hotel is about three blocks away from the Metro with many places to eat and drink in-between. My children are 8 and 10 years old and they loved everything about our hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone that is visiting DC whether you are just on business or traveling with your family. I will definately use the Washington Hilton again!!!!
reviews.title: Best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!!

reviews.text: First, this review is for the Washington Hilton. Some reviewers of this hotel appear to be talking about the Capitol Hilton. Don't stay here, but if you do, make sure you're clear to cab drivers. (Locals call it the Hinckley Hilton, a reference to its grim historical role.)
reviews.title: Nicely furnished, poorly managed. Stay elsewhere

reviews.text: The place looks great and has some nice amenities. Rooms are clean and feel new - paint carts were all over the place when we visited, so seems like they're committed to keeping them that way. Sparkling, large fitness center and a nice pool (though don't expect the lifeguards to let you stay in it to the posted closing time - they shut it down nearly ten minutes early, apparently eager to get home). The nice interior is the only thing keeping this from getting a "Terrible" TA rating.
reviews.title: Great location and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem is service, and I don't mean the people providing it. Everyone, literally everyone we met was excessively nice and seemed dedicated and experienced. But the people managing them don't seem to have it together and/or they haven't hired enough staff. I could offer a number of examples. Expect long waits for someone to pick up the guest services line. At least twice it took more than a dozen rings for someone to even answer, and neither was at an odd time. I asked around later and the hotel wasn't even full that day, so just imagine what it would be like if there's a big convention or something. At another point, there was a major mechanical problem in our room that required maintenance to fix it, which caused severe inconvenience. At other hotels, for much more minor issues I've been offered a room upgrade, bottle of wine, something to make up for the hassle. The maintenance guys were super nice and took care of the problem the same day, but management didn't even send an apology note.
reviews.title: Wonderful base for a visit to DC

reviews.text: Well, as many hotel choices as there are in DC, just picked this one blindly based on
reviews.title: Loved this hotel, would come back

reviews.text: Hilton's reputation. Clean facility overall, great outdoor pool, nice fitness center with
reviews.title: Can't fault it - everything was fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: free weights (unusual in hotels) , excellent service from the valet, front desk,
reviews.title: Nice spot for a quick washington visit

reviews.text: concierge, and the hotel restaurant (great Memorial Day outdoor barbecue!)
reviews.title: Great Value! I love the neighborhood!

reviews.text: Oh, and by the way food was good. Great home base to hit the highlights in DC.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: I thought my experience here was excellent. I got lost from the metro to get there, walked down Q street instead of up connecticut, and boy am I glad I did. There were historic federal era houses that I wouldn't have seen if I had just taken the strait shot. But I digress. Ugly from the outside, and not with a great view, but it was everything I wanted and needed. Nice people, clean bed, quiet room. Nothing that blew me away, but all in all a good experience.
reviews.title: Close to Dupont Circle

reviews.text: I stayed here for business but wish I'd had more time for pleasure. DC is a stunning, walkable city, terrific for exploring on foot with no particular agenda. The hotel is about half a mile from DuPont Circle and offers easy access to everything. The staff were helpful and courteous, room service was delicious, and the options nearby for a quick bite to each are plentiful. Use the exit on the Terrace level (instead of the main entrance in the front drive) to see the President's Walk, a stone tunnel where POTUS's motorcade pulls in when he delivers addresses here, which is frequently. In 1963, after the JFK assassination, the hotel built a covered walkway called The President's Walk - which, ironically, was the scene of the 1981 assassination attempt on Ronald Reagan. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reagan_assassination_attempt
reviews.title: Great location, slightly macabre history

reviews.text: Several reviews (and some of my colleagues) complained about parking, but if you're car free, it's an easy and relatively inexpensive cab ride. I paid $25 from Reagan National Airport, including tip.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: The only thing to note - the hotel is ENORMOUS, so if walking is an issue or if you have little ones, ask for a room close to the elevator. Also, my room was itty-bitty; not really an issue for me, though the bathroom was a bit claustrophobic - as in, banging my shins on the toilet when getting out of the shower and having to store toiletries in the closet because there's barely any vanity, But that's what you get in the big city!
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just happened to see a pop up on my computer screen for this hotel and decided to look into it. I usually stay closer to Embassy Row, but I am very happy that I decided to try this hotel instead. The price was very reasonable (especially since I got the parking package deal). It's located very close to Dupont Circle and not too far from Georgetown, the staff was pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice Enough.

reviews.text: We (family of 4) stayed here for three nights. Room was good but beds on the small side for doubles! American standard doubles tend to be smaller than European beds. Apart from that the room and bathroom were really nice with all facilities you need. Staff were exceptionally helpful and in plentiful supply. The hotel is large with a big bar and reception area with free internet access, concierge etc. There is a lovely outdoor pool, it was a bit crowded when we arrived but was easier once the weekend was over. Good gym also. The hotel is located a block away from a huge selection of good restaurants and cafes, we eat locally every night and had lots to chose from. You can also walk to the metro in 3-5 mins which brings you downtown in minutes. I would be happy to walk downtown to the Mall etc with all the museums in 30 mins but it was in the high 90's when we were there so we took cabs. Overall we would recommend the hotel, good value to be had particularly at the weekends when the business customers are not around.
reviews.title: Well located, great facilities and great value

reviews.text: I have been inspired to join Trip Advisor and write this review in hopes that no one else will have to suffer this hotel: Warning! This hotel is awful.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Price: rediculous, but this is Washington. However, you would expect that for the price you would expect much more.
reviews.title: My husband was impressed by the food!

reviews.text: 2. Noise: Do not expect to sleep here. If there is more than one person in the room next to yours, and they talk at night, you will hear every word they say. You will hear their phone. You will hear their laugh. You will hear EVERYTHING even with the fan on "HI" and if you turn around to sleep with your head at the foot of the bed. If you are forced to attend a conference here, stay at the Marriott Courtyard directly across the street.
reviews.title: Satisfied

reviews.text: 3. Once you complain about the noise, don't expect to get changed to a different room right away or get any type of compensation. The front desk manager told me: "We cannot control how loud our guests are". Really? I don't think they were particulary loud, the walls are incredibly thin, like paper. Finally I was told that I would be compensated, a refund of one night, but that was a lie. When I checked out, nothing had been removed from my bill. I had to go through the whole thing again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was comfortable and we slept well here. Visited the pool and it was great to swim and relax. Nearby to Dupont Circle Metro station and we walked to the zoo from here. Would be happy to return. Looked after cases after our check out for a dollar fee.
reviews.title: Vast hotel but comfortable
Good quality in great location
reviews.text: Solid hotel with dependable quality and a very friendly staff. Overall rooms are very clean and comfortable. Overpriced parking and overpriced food. Biggest Negative isis WIFI is not FREE. There is no reason in this age of technology to not have wifi as a basic option. This is so inconvenient. I was lucky because I have wifi hotspot on my iPad. Need FREE WIFI PLEASE. FREE WIFI. FREE WIFI
I stayed here for two nights, arriving late after a delayed flight into BWI. The supershuttle from BWI to DC was fairly quick and about $40. I dread to think how much a taxi would be.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton standards

reviews.text: I was the only person at reception unsurprisingly so was checked in quickly. The room was of typical hilton quality.
reviews.title: well-located, dependable quality

reviews.text: It is clearly a hotel that aims at the business market. As noted elsewhere, it is well used for conferences and events. The in-room internet is very expensive but free in the lobby. This really puzzles me, as it basically invites anyone into the hotel to use free internet while patrons have to fork out an additional $10 a day. I have a good, but not-suitable-for-kids idea of why this might be so common.
reviews.title: Good choice for business event

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights. All the people was nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was great with a variety of choices. My kids liked the indoor pool with life guard on duty even if there was less room because a class for neighbors!
reviews.title: Nice crew

reviews.text: The only thing bothered me was the smooking people at the terrace specially when we were eating with my kids!
reviews.title: Loved it! Very surprised for my last minute weekend getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saturday night was a movie night for kids...What a good idea!
reviews.title: Good hotel with room for improvement

reviews.text: I will go back there.
reviews.title: More that a business hotel ...

reviews.text: Stayed here for a quick very last minute weekend rendezvous and the hotel was perfect. The room was beautiful and spacious for the two of us, and very clean. Ismail at the Front Desk was very helpful!
reviews.title: Perfectly fine, great location, excellent value

reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights with two friends after previously staying in NY and before going to Boston.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton Business hotel charging Business prices

reviews.text: This is a very nice, large, quality, hotel with a huge lobby
reviews.title: Not for tourist, business travelers may enjoyed

reviews.text: There were several conventions on the go whilst we were there which made the hotel seem quite busy. We were also treated to a visit from Vice President Biden who was delivering a.speech to one of the conventions. From a British point of view it was interesting how the security services sprang into action A little inconvenient but a talking point as part of the holiday.
reviews.title: Amazing staff

reviews.text: The rooms are well equipped and reasonably modern. Large from a British point of view but probably small from a US view. Walls were a little thin but this did not bother us although our friends found it quite annoying to hear their neighbours TV during the small hours of the night.
reviews.title: Merle convention

reviews.text: We had a small problem with the safe but this was sorted very quickly - we were impressed with the service.
reviews.title: Washington hilton is a winner!
